page.title: 05Farming around Todmorden
page.content: All the farms around Todmorden are pastoral and keep sheep and cattle. Most farms are small and privately owned,keeping a variety of animals. Hardy hill sheep are grazed on the moors in summer and fed on hay in the winter.At the end of summer most of the lambs are sold at the market. The cattle are mainly stall-fed on cattle cake and hay.Many farmers produce milk and bottle it themselves, to sell to the residents of Todmorden. The valley sides are extremely steep and the soils are thin, stoney and acidic.The winters are often long and severe, leaving a very short growing season.The annual rainfall is often as high as 1500mm and the summers are cool and cloudy.For these reasons few crops can be grown except grass, which is cut for silage in the spring and for hay in summer.
